results.title: My life with my family
results.creator_credit: Negabanchi Tebeje, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Life, so far, has been quite a struggle for Negabanchi Tebeje and her family. With her dad fighting for democracy, the Tebeje family have moved from Ethiopia to Sudan and, finally, Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Negabanchi Tebeje, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Swan Lake
results.creator_credit: Askhat Murtazin, Felix Slidovker, Inessa Seleznova and Ekran Creative Union Gosteleradio
results.brief_description: Presents a magnificent performance of the ballet “Swan Lake” by the Bolshoi Ballet with music by Tchaikovsky. Features Natalia Bessmertnova, Alexander Bogatirov and Boris Akimov.

results.title: Suzi's story
results.creator_credit: Iain E. Gillespie, Carlyon-Gillespie Production and Pro-image
results.brief_description: This is the true story of the Lovegrove family. It is the story of Suzi, a loving wife and mother stricken with AIDS. This documentary poignantly deals with this tragic and deadly virus, and seeks to educate the viewer about the debilitating effects of AIDS not only on the victim, but on those who love her. This film sensitively brings home the reality of AIDS. It won’t easily be forgotten.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Iain E. Gillespie, Carlyon-Gillespie Production and Pro-image

results.title: Swimming
results.brief_description: A young girl is given a video recorder as a gift. Structured as a video and super-8 diary, this compelling short film investigates the devastating effects on a child of adult secrets. This exceptional Australian short film is a first person narrative conveyed completely through point of view and mise-en-scene. Cast features Steve Jacobs and Lynette Curran.

results.title: Suzdal
results.brief_description: A tour of the unique museum-town of Suzdal. This town, a treasure of Russian culture, is the home of more than seventy architectural masterpieces of the 13th to the 19th centuries. Introduction and some credits in English. Remainder of film musical background only.

results.title: Rainbow serpent
results.creator_credit: Richard Guthrie, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Commonwealth Dept of Aboriginal Affairs
results.brief_description: Presents the cultural heritage of the first Australians through their own eyes. In an unbiased, unpatronising light it paints a realistic picture of a society whose tarnished image was created by those who supposedly made this country - the European settlers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Guthrie, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Commonwealth Dept of Aboriginal Affairs
